title: Kismas Linear Lamp 01
body: A steel lighting base and a modern, newly made glass block with 7 dimmable colour tones.
alt: A dimmable glass lamp from Kismas Design Studio

title: Red Nessino Lamp
body: The unexpected red theory - you always just need one random red item, big or small, in the room and automatically it looks better.
alt: Classic red Nessino lamp from Artemide

title: Animal Logo
body: Another 30th birthday gift - the 10th anniversary edition of the iconic book from Counter Print.
alt: A book that talks about Apple's design during the golden age

title: X - Cigarettes after Sex
body: Limited clear vinyl, will be released by Partisan Records on 12 July 2024
alt: X by Cigarettes after Sex 12 inch vinyl album

title: Animal Crossing: New Horizons
body: A 30th birthday gift, and now my favourite game that I've racked up over 120 hours on.
alt: Animal Crossing game for the intendo Switch

title: Nintendo Switch OLED
notes: Purchased in Hong Kong, Hong Kong
body: These days, I pick up the switch more so than my own phone.
alt: A red and blue Nintendo Switch OLED gaming console

title: Analog Today
body: The simplest productivity system - 76mm x 127mm printed on 100# smooth uncoated paper with smooth corners.
alt: Minimalist notepad with a list for today

title: Filippa K Turtleneck
body: The first camel addition to the all black wardrobe - there can never be too many turtlenecks in the wardrobe.
alt: A camel coloured wool turtleneck jumper

title: Small Transparent Speaker
body: Made out of tempered glass and aluminium - 3.3kg and about 268mm x 203 mm x 95mm
alt: Transparent rectangular speaker with black accents

title: Ricoh GR IIIx
body: It does its job well and I love the pocket factor, user modes and handy recipes.
alt: A pocketable Ricoh GR IIIx camera in black

title: Mac Studio Display
body: A huge fan of the 27 inch 5K retina screen, I can now zoom in 9000x and draw the ultimate pixel perfect rectangles in Figma.
alt: Large silver retina display monitor from Apple

title: Anya Hindmarch Kit Kat
body: This was a surprise Christmas gift inspired by an inside joke. It is my emergency kit kat for moments when my blood sugar levels drop.
alt: A kit kat bar made in leather from Anya Hindmarch

title: Annie Bing Diana Jacket
body: I loved the menswear inspired fit with the double breasting closing and wool fabric.
alt: Black double faced wool jacket from COS

title: Aesop Rozu
body: Inspired by French modernist Charlotte Perriand, it is a fragrance of tender intensity. Floral, green and woody.
alt: An amber glass Aesop perfume bottle with a black cap

title: Craighill Ripple (Carbon)
body: Milled from 5/8 inch diameter stainless steel with a Black nitrocarburized finish, it features a classic churchkey-style that is both functional and stylish.
alt: A minimal steel bottle opener with rippled edges

title: Acne Studios Fairview Face
body: You can't call yourself a designer without a standard black sweatshirt in the wardrobe.
alt: Black sweatshirt with classic Acne studio face logo

title: Loewe Anagram Belt
body: I have always loved Loewe, their subtle luxury and beautiful anagram logo.
alt: Black leather belt with a gold Loewe anagram logo

title: Audo CPH JWDA Lamp
body: Inspired by traditional oil lamps and crafted in glass, solid metal and a brass dimmer switch, the JWDA Portable has the freedom and flexibility to move anywhere you want.
alt: Minimal JWDA dimmable lamp from Audo Copenhagen

title: BoConcept Velvet Leaf
body: Inspired by natural leaves, this decorative sculpture made of curved aluminum could be a great addition to the dining table.
alt: A black leaf sculpture from BoConcept

title: Ganni City Boot
body: Made from a blend of recycled rubber and elastic panels, it is the perfect winter boots.
alt: A pair of black heeled rubber boots from Ganni

title: Muuto Base Table
body: A beautifully crafted black table top with rounded corners and matte black steel legs, it is both the dining table and daytime work desk.
alt: Black plywood tabletop with matte black steel legs

title: HAY J77
body: Originally designed in the 1960s by Folke Pålsson, the J77 Chair has been reimagined by HAY.
alt: A black wooden chair from danish brand, HAY

title: Blue Lucky Cat
body: Three friends walked into Illum and three lucky cats were purchased - blue, orange and green. And now, each cat sits somewhere, in each designer’s house.
alt: A blue lucky cat with a waving arm

title: Bao
body: I love food, clean design and physical books. Strictly for viewing pleasure, never attempted making a steamed bun.
alt: A blue lucky cat with a waving arm

title: Hay Quilton
body: Crafted by the London design duo Doshi Levein, the sofa is part of the flexible Quilton modular system created with FSC-certified wood from sustainable forests.
alt: Light grey quilted L shaped sofa by HAY

title: Lululemon High Rise Cropped
body: One of my favourite casual bottoms for everday errands, and the only pair of joggers that don't make me look like a Hobbit.
alt: Clear Byredo perfume bottle with a black rounded cap

title: Balenciaga City Bag S
body: I finally found the bag in store, after originally discovering it over 10 years ago.
notes: Purchased in Hong Kong, Hong Kong
alt: A pocketable Ricoh GR IIIx camera in black

title: Frame Le Original Cropped
body: Embracing the freedom of a slim straight cut, my legs feel liberated from my old skin tight jeans.
alt: High waisted cropped, straight cut blue jeans

title: Acne Studios Emmbar Face
body: I'm a massive sucker for Acne Studio's face logos on all of their basic tops.
alt: Black Acne Studios short sleeved T-shirt

title: APC Hide
body: A.P.C are one of my favourite brands for its minimalist, laid-back attitude.
alt: White APC sneakers in leather

title: Creative Selection
body: Thsi is still one of my favourite “product” books to date - favourite snippet was about how the keyboard on iPhones were made.
alt: A book that talks design and minimalism by Kenya Hara

title: Baggu Puffy Sleeve
body: I love this because it's bright, fun, puffy and does the job of protecting my laptop in my bag.
alt: Orange puffy laptop sleeve with a banana print

title: Reformation Mason
body: The first pair of wide legged trousers that needed no alterations - perfect length right away.
alt: A pair of wide legged high waisted black trousers from Reformation

title: No Idea is Final
body: A coffee table book for the living room - for designers, 'no idea is final' is so true for everything.
alt: An orange book from Phaidon publishing

title: Rains Mini Roll Top
body: I needed a waterproof bag for the Scottish weather and the muted sand colour caught my eye.
alt: A sand coloured waterproof roll top backpack

title: Byredo Black Saffron
body: Woody with a hint of spice. This was my first bottle of expensive perfume after discovering Scandinavian design.
alt: Clear Byredo perfume bottle with a black rounded cap

title: Designing Design
body: Still yet to be read, but I was once told that this was the holy grail of design.
alt: A book that talks design and minimalism by Kenya Hara

title: Nothing 1
body: Active noise cancellation, 4.7g and sound by Teenage Engineering with up to 34 hours of listening
alt: White earphones in a transparent case from Nothing

title: Normann Copenhagen Porta Lamp
body: Dimmable, portable and sleek - that was search criteria for a pair of new bedside lamps.
alt: A black portable lamp from Normann Copenhagen

title: Altura Step Stool
body: Designed by Patricia Perez, and named after the Spanish word for height, the Altura stool doubles up as a step stool and quirky bedside table. No assembly required.
alt: Black asymmetric step stool that doubles as a side table

title: Stax River Hamburger
body: Who doesn't love a hamburger coaster when it's well designed with the lettuce doubling up as a funnel holder?
alt: A set of wooden coasters that form a hamburger

title: Alessi Plisse
body: New home means new stuff and since it was a home to two designers, we could not have ugly kitchen appliances on the counter.
alt: Matt black Alessi Plisse kettle

title: DOIY Bento
body: Probably a designer thing but I love the playful yet functional design, it made my sad looking lunches so much happier.
alt: A two tiered lunch box thar looks like a salmon sashimi

title: IKEA Frekvens
body: Modular speaker system from IKEA x Teenage Engineering - it was my first design gift from a group of designers.
alt: An IKEA square, black speaker that also doubles as a lamp

title: Birkenstock Gizeh
body: The better looking, well supported and well worn flip flops for my duck feet
alt: Stone coloured leather Birkenstock sandals

title: Horizn Studio Gion
body: Simple, water-repellent, black and it fits my phone, wallet and keys.
alt: A black waterproof bum bag from Horizn Studio

title: Totem (2019)
body: Totem - a limited edition souvenir from the design conference, OFFF in Barcelona, 2019.
alt: A black limited edition book from the OFFF festival in Barcelona

title: Keychron K3
body: An ultra slim wireless keyboard with an aluminium body - it weighs about 483g and measures 306mm x 116mm.
alt: A wireless mechnical keyboard from Keychron
